did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: Scrapbook prepared by Harvey E. Shepherd, class of 1932, as a Cadet and graduate student at Virginia Polytechnic Institute. Additional loose materials kept in the scrapbook.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Harvey E. Shepherd Collection, Ms2003-020, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Harvey E. Shepherd Collection was donated to the Special Collections in 1993.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Harvey E. Shepherd Collection commenced and was completed in October, 2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Harvey Earl Shepherd, from Front Royal, Virginia, earned a degree in Chemistry at Virginia Polytechnic Institute in 1932. He served in teh Corps of Cadets in Companies B and D. He was on the staff of the publication The Virginia Tech, the VPI Skipper, and the Bugle. Shepherd was also a member of the Dramatic Club, the Shenandoah Valley Club, the Chemical Club, and Pi Delta Epsilon. Shepherd also did graduate work at VPI.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Harvey E. Shepherd scrapbook spans the years 1928 to 1932. The leather covered scrapbook with memory book and the VPI seal on the cover has 49 leaves. The scrapbook contains line drawings, correspondence, official notification and receipts, class tickets, images, programs, clippings, ticket stubs, invitations, Thanksgiving Dinner menu (1929), college blueprints, photographs, letterhead, Corps of Cadets materials, Virginia Baptist Student Convention program, YMCA membership card, and permission slips from Chemical Warfare ROTC Camp at Edgewood Arsenal, Maryland. Also included is a white belt with no buckle marked H.E. Shepherd Co. B.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The scrapbook is arranged loosely chronologically. The original order has been retained. Loose materials and a cloth belt have been put in separate folders.

did.unittitle: Loose materials house in the Memory Book
White belt with no buckle marked H. E. SHEPHERD CO B.
